definition: to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: These ten are broad and even a bit philosophical.
sentences.chinese: 這十條貼士很寬泛，甚至有一點偏哲學。

sentences.english: What are your favorite ways to save money while traveling?
sentences.chinese: 哪種旅遊省錢貼士最合你心意呢？

sentences.english: Get expert tips and advice on cobblers and shoe care in this free video.
sentences.chinese: 在這個自由獲取視頻專家貼士鞋匠和鞋護理和諮詢。

sentences.english: Experiment with these tips and find what works best for you.
sentences.chinese: 體驗下這些貼士，找出什麼對你是有利的。

sentences.english: These tips can help you safely — and enjoyably — exercise when the weather turns chilly.
sentences.chinese: 這些貼士可以幫助你在天氣轉冷是安全愉快地鍛鍊。

sentences.english: On top of all that, I'd like to invite you to sign up for my free, 3-times-weekly dating tips newsletter.
sentences.chinese: 另外，我誠邀您註冊我的一週三次的約會貼士通訊。

sentences.english: Any other tips on how to communicate your contact data?
sentences.chinese: 還有其他傳達你聯繫資料的貼士嗎？

sentences.english: Follow these tipsto work on perfecting your running form.
sentences.chinese: 跟隨着這些貼士去完善你的跑步方式。

definition: to talk from one's personal experience/to use oneself as an example
(Tw) medical checkup/physical examination (abbr. for 健康檢查|健康检查[jian4 kang1 jian3 cha2])
to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
a trick/an ingenious method/know-how/the knack (of doing sth)
a swindle/a trap/a racket/a scam/CL:場|场[chang3]
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
